head.title: Fed May Be Ready To Tighten Its Grip

hedline.hl1: Fed May Be Ready To Tighten Its Grip

block.p: The Federal Reserve, taking advantage of stable prices and increases in productivity spurred by technology, has given the economy more or less free rein since 1995.
But there are tentative but worrisome signs that inflation is emerging from hibernation.
The Federal Reserve, taking advantage of stable prices and increases in productivity spurred by technology, has given the economy more or less free rein since 1995.
But there are tentative but worrisome signs that inflation is emerging from hibernation.

With that in mind, when Fed policy makers meet on Tuesday to consider whether to raise interest rates, they may feel compelled to adopt a more aggressive stance. Analysts expect the central bank to raise its benchmark interest rate by one-half percentage point at the meeting.
